instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01598: What is 820-01598? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.C7020: What is C7020? Capacitor between current sense lines on ISL6259 chip for charger current sensing, you should measure around 20.02 ohms across this. Often when the resistance across this capacitor is higher it is because one of the current sense resistors going to the ISL6259 chip has failed. When current sensing resistors between the shunt resistor and the ISL6259 power IC have failed the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing as much power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Only turns on if battery and touchpad is disconnected.
threads.message:
Hi, everyone.
Hope you can give some light on this issue.
Got this MacBook with no display.
When disconnecting the battery and touchpad it boots to the system, but if either is connected it will not display, or sometimes the Apple logo and kernel panic.
I've replaced the touchpad and battery and still have the same issue.
Tried to revive it and got this message

The operation couldn’t be completed.
(AMRestoreErrorDomain error -1 - Failed to handle message type StatusMsg (Generic error))
[AMRestoreErrorDomain – 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF (-1) [sys = 0x3F, sub = 0xFFF, code = 0x3FFF (16383)]]

Now I f up the T2 firmware and it won't boot any more.

Can someone help me, please?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Only turns on if battery and touchpad is disconnected.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Only turns on if battery and touchpad is disconnected.
threads.message:
I've tried to restore and revive and no results.
The problem now is that it won't turn on even with batt and touchpad disconnected.
T2 firmware is corrupted.
Any ideas on this, please?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Only turns on if battery and touchpad is disconnected.
threads.message:
I've tried to dfu revive and restore in many ways. With and without battery, touchpad.
Nothing works.
I've connected everything and done dfu revive and halfway in the process I've disconnected the battery flex cable.
It went all the process and back to life. But still same issue.
Turns on and goes to the system only with battery and touchpad disconnected

I've swapped the logic board on another complete, fully working mac and the problem is the same.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Only turns on if battery and touchpad is disconnected.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Only turns on if battery and touchpad is disconnected.
threads.message:
<CAPACITOR>C7020</CAPACITOR> – 3.3 ohms
<CAPACITOR>C7023</CAPACITOR> – 2.7 ohms
I could not install the system again on internet mode.
Every time it goes to globe and after Apple logo it reboots.
I enter in Target disk mode and cloned the system from another mac, and it boots to the system again. (Battery and Touchpad disconnected)
Only battery connected no display and looping, fan swoosh high speed every 1 minute.
Only touchpad connected, it shows Apple logo and them message this mac restart because of a problem.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Only turns on if battery and touchpad is disconnected.
threads.message: Got this kernel panic screen once.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Only turns on if battery and touchpad is disconnected.
threads.message:
Looks like CPU issue.

Can you boot Windows without trackpad connected?
